summary: This document is a chain of emails from September 2008 among U.S. Attorney's Office (USAFLS) staff and others regarding the sealed Federal Non-Prosecution Agreement in the State of Florida vs. Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails discuss how to handle a media inquiry from The Palm Beach Daily News about the sealed agreement and the obligation to keep it sealed.

persons.name: Marie
persons.context: Mentioned in an email as having a conversation about notifying Jack Goldberger regarding the filing of the remainder of the Epstein agreement and the unsealing issue.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Referenced as needing to be notified that he has yet to file the remainder of the Agreement and that the unsealing issue is between him/Epstein and the State Attorney's Office (SAO).

persons.name: Ann Marie C. Marano
persons.context: Forwards an email from Barry Krischer to colleagues (Acosta, Sloman, Senior, Lee, Atkinson) seeking guidance on how to handle the issue of the sealed non-prosecution agreement raised by the media.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.context: Listed as a recipient of Ann Marie Marano's forwarded email regarding how to handle the sealed agreement issue.

persons.name: Jeff Sloman
persons.context: Listed as a recipient of Ann Marie Marano's forwarded email regarding how to handle the sealed agreement issue.

persons.name: Robert Senior
persons.context: Listed as a recipient of Ann Marie Marano's forwarded email regarding how to handle the sealed agreement issue.

persons.name: Dexter Lee
persons.context: Listed as a recipient of Ann Marie Marano's forwarded email regarding how to handle the sealed agreement issue.

persons.name: Karen Atkinson
persons.context: Listed as a recipient of Ann Marie Marano's forwarded email regarding how to handle the sealed agreement issue.

persons.name: Rolando Garcia
persons.context: Copied on Ann Marie Marano's forwarded email; was the initial recipient of an email from Barry Krischer on the same issue.

persons.name: Barry Krischer
persons.context: Former Palm Beach County State Attorney who forwarded a media inquiry to the U.S. Attorney's Office, asking for advice on how to proceed regarding the sealed non-prosecution agreement in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Lanna Belohlavek
persons.context: Receives an email from Bryce Albu regarding the sealed agreement and forwards it to Barry Krischer, asking 'How to proceed?'

persons.name: Bryce Albu
persons.role: Attorney representing The Palm Beach Daily News
persons.context: Writes to Lanna Belohlavek on behalf of The Palm Beach Daily News, inquiring about the nature and basis for sealing the non-prosecution agreement in the Epstein case to advise his client on whether to pursue unsealing.

persons.name: Martin Reeder
persons.context: Copied on Bryce Albu's initial email to Lanna Belohlavek regarding the sealed agreement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the case 'State v. Jeffrey Epstein'; the non-prosecution agreement in question is related to his plea.

connections.description: Albu, representing The Palm Beach Daily News, contacts Belohlavek to inquire about the sealed Epstein non-prosecution agreement.
Belohlavek forwards Albu's inquiry to Krischer, her superior, seeking guidance on how to proceed.
Krischer forwards the media inquiry about the sealed agreement to Garcia at the U.S. Attorney's Office.
Marano forwards the issue to Acosta and other senior colleagues within the U.S. Attorney's Office for a decision on how to handle it.
Implied by the email stating the unsealing issue is between 'him/Epstein and the SAO's office,' suggesting Goldberger is Epstein's attorney.

events.title: Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement Sealed
events.description: A Federal Non-Prosecution Agreement related to Jeffrey Epstein's plea was filed under seal by court order.

events.title: Media Inquiry on Sealed Agreement
events.description: Attorney Bryce Albu, representing The Palm Beach Daily News, contacts the State Attorney's Office to inquire about the sealed non-prosecution agreement in the Epstein case.

events.title: Internal DOJ Discussion on Sealing
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office staff internally discuss their lack of obligation to seek continued sealing of the agreement and how to handle the media inquiry forwarded by State Attorney Barry Krischer.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
250 S. Central Blvd., Suite 200 (Reeder & Reeder P.A. office)
keyFacts: A Federal Non-Prosecution Agreement related to Jeffrey Epstein's plea was filed under seal, a fact discovered by The Palm Beach Daily News in 2008.
The U.S. Attorney's Office (USAFLS) internally concluded they had 'no obligation to seek its continued sealing,' shifting the issue to Epstein's attorney and the State Attorney's Office.
The email chain involves high-level officials, including then-U.S. Attorney Alex Acosta, discussing how to handle media scrutiny over the sealed agreement.
The correspondence reveals early media and legal attention to the secrecy surrounding the Epstein plea deal years before it became a major public controversy.
